setup: Why was the math book so sad?
punchline: Because it had too many problems!

setup: Why do plants hate math?
punchline: Because it gives them square roots!

setup: What do you call a number that can't stay still?
punchline: A roamin' numeral!

setup: Why did the student eat her math homework?
punchline: The teacher told her it was a piece of cake!

setup: Why was 6 afraid of 7?
punchline: Because 7 ate 9!

setup: What tool is best for math?
punchline: Multi-pliers!

setup: How do you stay warm in a cold room?
punchline: Go sit in the corner — it's always 90 degrees!

setup: What did the zero say to the eight?
punchline: Nice belt!

setup: How many times can you subtract 5 from 25?
punchline: Only once — after that it's 20, then 15…

setup: What's a math teacher's favourite tree?
punchline: Geometry!

setup: Why did the two fours skip lunch?
punchline: Because they already 8!

setup: What do you get when you cross a calculator with a best friend?
punchline: Someone you can always count on!

setup: Why did the student stand on her calculator?
punchline: She wanted to reach a higher number!

setup: What's the difference between a teacher and a train?
punchline: One says 'spit out that gum', the other says 'choo choo'!

setup: What do you call friends who love math?
punchline: Algebros!

setup: Why is a math test like a sneeze?
punchline: You feel it coming but you can't stop it!

setup: I'll do algebra, trigonometry, even statistics…
punchline: But graphing? That's where I draw the line!

setup: What do mathematicians eat on Halloween?
punchline: Pumpkin pi!

setup: Why is 10 the bravest number?
punchline: Because it always comes first — even between 9 and 11!

setup: What's a tornado's favourite math?
punchline: Twister-onometry!
